result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and PAC Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony] was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard J. Clemens was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J. Clemens

records.addlTxt: DEF's debt has been resent to WI Dept of Revenue/SDC this date after correcting the SS#. cah

Received a call from Dana @ WI Dept of Revenue asking if we would look into the SS# associated w/Debt ID#2005388, as they received calls from both Richard Clemens Jr & Richard Clemens Sr indicating we have the wrong SS#.  After looking into the matter, it appears the SS# on this debt belongs to Richard Clemens Sr, not Jr.  The SS# has been corrected on this case and will be resubmitted to the WI Dept of Revenue. cah

From DE stating he has questions about his debt w/SDC. Ret'd call to DE & DE advised me that his father's bank acct has been levied, not his own. I inquired if the DE shares the same name as his father, to which he stated that his father's name is Ricky Joe Clemens and his (the DE) is Richard Joseph Clemens. DE was advised he will need to contact SDC & was given their ph #. jaf

DE appeared. DE was advised by the bookkeeper that he has been turned over to Collections & may contact them to set up a Pymt Plan. DE was also advised that he had been recently making pymts 20-25 days late & his pymts were also short. DE stated he didn't know his pymts were supposed to be $25, but was shown a copy of the Pymt Plan that was sent to him, which was ordered by the judge, & advised it had not been ret'd. DE to contact SDC. cah/jaf
Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.      Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees = $700.00. eif

Order for payment on May 6, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Richard J. Clemens appeared. Case called at 11:24. ADA Hartung updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 to misdemeanor OWI 3 in 15CF336. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. DE acknowledges priors. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 in 15CF336. On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF336. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence I/S  1 year St. Croix County Jail
2 years probation with conditions
- 60 days  conditional jail time to be served 30 days  every year of probation.
   Court will authorize a furlough 1 day of the month as not to lose benefits. 
   Court authorizes huber for treatment. 
- Fine inclusive of costs $2252.00 to be paid through probation.
- AODA and any recommended follow through.
- 30 mo DL revocation
- 30 mo IID
- Random and regular testing.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to complete 10 hours of community service
- DE to complete restorative justice. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

DE is remanded.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Richard J. Clemens appeared. Case called at 2:03. S/T Sgt. J. Kennett St. Croix County Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA Hartung. Sgt. Kennett identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State files the Information.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to all counts.   State to provide discovery within 10 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's. Filed by Atty Chapman.
Appointing Atty Chapman. km
Preliminary hearing at 08-12-2015 02:00 pm

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

-  Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.K. Nichels.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad special appearance for today only.   DF:  Richard J. Clemens appeared. Case called at 8:46. Includes 15CF336, 15CT93. Court reviews files. ADA Hartung files a motion to dismiss on the 15CT93. On 15CF336 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Atty. Smestad updates the court, there is a conflict of interest. Def understands. Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
